newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on retail and interbank interest, dealers said on Tuesday.

"Government securities closed narrowly mixed today amid uncertainty over the near-term direction of the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly lower, but bond prices were narrowly mixed. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.53/2.48 percent compared with Monday's yield of 2.55/2.50 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.32/2.27 percent against 2.33/2.28 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$97.95/98.00 from Monday's close of S$97.93/97.98, September 2001 at S$96.55/96.60 versus S$96.77/96.82 and June 2003 at S$95.20/95.25 against S$95.48/95.53.
The overnight interbank offered rate was unchanged from Monday's 3-1/2 3-3/8 percent.
